featured_prop.Remarks: Legendary, Iconic, Important. Commissioned by famed interior designer Arthur Elrod who simply asked his architect John Lautner to "Give me what you think I should have on this lot". featured_prop.Remarks: The ultimate Old Las Palmas estate, taking inspiration from the architecture of the desert's modernism movement. This Palm Springs modern estate embodies the best of the area's coveted architecture with a level of luxury never offered before. Nearly 1.5 acres of grounds created by renowned landscape architect Steve Martino is securely maintained by gates, walls & soaring privacy hedge. The roughly 8000 SF home designed by A. Quincy Jones disciple, Donn Boss AIA is surrounded by 7 negative edge pools & multiple fire features making the home appear to float on water or balance on glass, offering a dramatic living experience unique to the area. Limestone and riff cut oak floors combined with the Varenna Poliform kitchen, Agape bathrooms and Fleetwood doors & windows speak to the level of overall quality & detail throughout. For those wanting to be in Old Las Palmas yet desire newer construction, expansive grounds, privacy & tennis court, this is the finest offering ever on the market.

featured_prop.Remarks: Located on possibly the best lot at The Vintage Club and maybe in the whole valley. Views reach to the mountains and lot is very private. The pool yard is flat and large, allowing for grand parties. The home lends itself to indoor/outdoor living - rooms flow easily to the outside. It is contemporary and mid-century in feel with decor designed by the famous designer, Steve Chase. The recently remodeled circular master bedroom is all glass, showing off breathtaking views from all angles. An office overlooking the valley is tucked to the side, out of the view corridor. The master bath is very large. A dramatic living room, study, bar, and dining room overlook the stunning pool area. Also included is a wall of windows with floor to ceiling desert garden views. The home has an additional bedroom with bath and an attached casita with kitchenette, 2 bedrooms and 2 baths located at the opposite end of the house. Residence is attractive and dramatic! Membership is optional.

featured_prop.Directions: Highway 111 to Southridge Drive.
featured_prop.Remarks: Designed by renowned Palm Springs architect Hugh Kaptur in 1964, the home was later purchased by Steve McQueen as his Palm Springs getaway. Designed as an intersection of two glass boxes and framed all in steel, the living room cantilevers over the mountainside with views to the massive mountains toward the west and the city below. The bedroom wing hovers over the large swimming pool. The home is located on a lot adjacent to the famed Elrod/Lautner home and features such architectural details as a floating staircase, walls of glass, and pecky cypress paneling. Carpeted with lush Edward Fields rugs, the home is mostly intact from when McQueen owned it. "Great Houses come with great materials", Hugh Kaptur.

featured_prop.Directions: Highway 111 to Southridge Drive.
featured_prop.Remarks: Designed by renowned architect Michael P. Johnson and called the Boat House, this home is situated on a triangular shaped lot. The lot defines the home by giving it the shape of a massive ship's prow which floats above the desert floor below. The bridge of this vessel is the master bedroom which commands a view above the triangular shaped great room with immense walls of glass that juts above the city lights beyond. Built for race car driver Jim Jeffords, sharp angles and triangle motifs are key design elements here. Perfect for entertaining, the home features secluded and private guest suites. The master bedroom features a skylight for nighttime star gazing.

featured_prop.Directions: Contact Listing Agent.
featured_prop.Remarks: Villa Maggio - Designed by Architect Ross Patton for Frank Sinatra in 1970. Located just off Pines to Palms Highway, a short 15 minute drive from Palm Desert. Villa Maggio was named after the character Private Angelo Maggio that Sinatra played in the movie, From Here to Eternity''. He owned the property for 12 years, using it for his own personal use and also hosting members of the Rat Pack, socialites and dignitaries. Rich in Sinatra history, this estate will offer you breathtaking views from Palm Springs to Indio. The integrity of Mr. Sinatra's Secret Hideaway is meticulously protected and maintained by the only other residents since Frank himself held the property. The current owners (also a celebrity family) now proudly offer this classic slice of our American entertainment history, Frank Sinatra'sVilla Maggio.

Clean, linear rooflines and the walls of glass balanced with natural redwood ceilings and simple, organic finishes throughout create the intended function of mid-century modern indoor/outdoor living. This is the personal residence of the Smiths, the design team that created both the Korakia and Sparrows Hotels.
